item.title: How Long Has Hollow Knight: Silksong Been in Development?
item.content:encoded:
Video games can take a long time to make. Certain titles receive extensive development time—Hollow Knight: Silksong being an apt case study. Its development became one of myth and legend at one point, but Team Cherry’s carefully created baby is ready to be born into the world.

I played Hollow Knight: Silksong at Gamescom 2025. My 15-minute demo gave me instant hope that the sequel is going to live up to the fevered hype. I’ve said before that you will struggle to find an indie sequel with this much popularity and pressure resting on its nimble shoulders.

Hollow Knight: Silksong‘s development ride has taken a few detours. Let’s revisit history and fill in some blanks for you.

How Long Has Team Cherry Developed Hollow Knight: Silksong For?

It’s estimated that Hollow Knight: Silksong’s development first began in 2018, meaning the game has been in development for seven long years!

This means official work on Silksong began only one year after Hollow Knight was released, and a year before the general public was introduced to Hollow Knight: Silksong altogether.

A fascinating article was released in August 2025 detailing why Hollow Knight: Silksong took so long to release. Quite simply, Team Cherry was having too much fun crafting the game, experimenting with new ideas, and making sure Silksong was worthy of being a sequel—instead of the DLC it was originally intended as.

When Was Hollow Knight: Silksong First Announced?

Hollow Knight: Silksong was first revealed to the world on Feb. 14, 2019, through its reveal trailer.

You can find the “Hollow Knight: Silksong Reveal Trailer” on Team Cherry‘s YouTube channel. The two-minute trailer shows off a decent amount of Silksong, and it seemed like it wouldn’t be that long until we got our hands on the sequel.

Little did we know that it would take over six years until the game launched (and it’s still not technically out yet).

Check out the original reveal trailer below and see if you can spot anything from the Silksong demo or recent trailers and footage.

You can throw the words myth and legend into the bin. Silksong is coming. Team Cherry’s effort should be worth the wait, and I’ll be diving into Pharloom the second it launches. I’m genuinely so excited for Silksong, but let me know your thoughts on it through the Insider Gaming forum.

You should also stick around and see if Silksong is on the Switch or Switch 2, and if you need to play Hollow Knight before Silksong.

item.title: Complete NBA 2K26 Trophy List—How to Get All Achievements & Trophies
item.content:encoded:
NBA 2K26 is ready to burst onto the scene, and there’s plenty for completionists to work on, with a long list of trophies and achievements to earn.

Available from September 5, or August 29 for those with early access, NBA 2K26 will put long-term players of the franchise back on the drawing board with a fresh start in the likes of MyCAREER and MyTEAM.

That means there’s a fresh batch of achievements and trophies to hunt down, all of which are detailed in this guide.

All NBA 2K26 Trophies & Achievements

Claiming all trophies and achievements in NBA 2K26 requires playing through every game mode there is to offer.

From Street Kings to MyCAREER, MyTEAM to Play Now Online, there is a host of objectives to objectives to tick off. There are also a handful of secret trophies and achievements, which won’t show unless manually selected.

We’ve listed all the basic objectives below.

All NBA 2K26 Secret Trophies & Achievements

NBA 2K26 only has three secret trophies and achievements to earn, and we’ve got them below – so consider this your final spoiler warning.

The secret trophies and achievements in NBA 2K26 are all in the MyTEAM mode, with two related to winning auctions for players, and the other requiring a shutout in a Breakout game.

All the secret objectives are below.

How Many Trophies & Achievements in NBA 2K26?

There are 49 total achievements in NBA 2K26, totalling 1000 Gamerscore on Xbox, while PlayStation players have an extra trophy to chase down with the coveted Platinum Trophy.

Most are low-scoring and low-rarity, with the majority also being fairly easy to track as they’re often one-and-done objectives. Some require some tracking, like winning with all NBA teams, but on the grand scheme of things, it’s not a bad game to try and 100% complete.

Are you planning to complete all of the trophies and achievements in NBA 2K26? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more NBA 2K26, check out whether the title is included with Xbox Game Pass, and take a look at the full soundtrack.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: The Mix Fall Game Showcase 2025: Everything Announced
item.content:encoded:
PAX West is underway in Seattle, Washington, and with it comes even more games for fans to see and learn about. To kick the event off comes The Mix Fall Game Showcase for 2025 with dozens of upcoming independent games being shown.

The showcase starts at Noon ET/9am PT on August 29, and can be watch via Twitch or YouTube. For your convenience, the YouTube stream has been embedded below.

As far as what to expect, The Mix Summer Game Showcase 2025 lasted roughly two hours, and featured 75 upcoming indie games. That means, not only will it be a packed show, but there should be something for everyone, no matter what type of gamer your are.

While the show airs, you can find details of everything announced below, along with the trailers that were shown (make sure you refresh the page to get the latest trailers). Be sure to let us know in the Insider Gaming forum what your favorite reveal was and what you are most excited for.

If you want even more showcase recaps and trailers, check out everything that was announced at Opening Night Live 2025 and Future Games Show at Gamescom 2025.

Everything Announced During The Mix Fall Game Showcase 2025

We will be updating this article live during The Mix Fall Game Showcase 2025, with all the latest reveals added in the order they were shown.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

Elden Ring Nightreign Is About To Get Even Harder In New Update

If you thought Elden Ring Nightreign couldn’t get any harder, think again; an update is adding new difficulty settings.

Battlefield Labs Testing Resumes Following End of BF6 Open Beta

EA has announced that Battlefield Labs is back and players can start testing the game again before its October 10 launch date.

Paramount Seeking Rights To Make A Call of Duty Movie, It’s Claimed

It has been claimed that Paramount is seeking to acquire the rights to make a Call of Duty movie, which is reportedly a ‘priority’.

Mafia: The Old Country Releases August 2025 Patch Notes

The latest update for Mafia: The Old Country is out now and the patch notes have been released.

item.title: Is NBA 2K26 Coming to Xbox Game Pass?
item.content:encoded:
September is a huge month for sports games with several big titles on the horizon, with NBA 2K26 among those poised for launch, and we’ve got the details on whether Game Pass subscribers have access to the game.

Releasing fully on September 5, though it’s available from August 29 for those with early access, NBA 2K26 is the latest entry in the long-running franchise and is always among the most popular games every year.

With September stacked full of big releases, a Game Pass subscription can save you some money, and we’ve got details on whether the service includes NBA 2K26.

Can You Play NBA 2K26 on Xbox Game Pass?

No, NBA 2K26 will not be available to play with an Xbox Game Pass subscription when it launches on September 5th.

NBA 2K26 is not an Xbox first-party title, which would see it immediately made available through the service. Unlike rivals EA Sports, there’s no free trial period with a Game Pass subscription either.

Although the first wave of titles launching on Game Pass in September is yet to be announced, NBA 2K26 is a huge release and, if it were to be on the service, we’d have been told by now. On top of this, the Xbox Store page would have a button that states the title would be ‘Coming to Game Pass’ alongside the purchase option.

With no such announcement and no Game Pass badge on the store page, the game will definitely not be on the service at launch.

Will NBA 2K26 Come to Xbox Game Pass?

NBA 2K26 could come to the Xbox Game Pass service in the future, although no official word has confirmed this.

2K has a close relationship with Xbox, with a free-play weekend for Game Pass subscribers for NBA 2K25 last year, while NBA 2K24 had a six-month stint on the service previously.

Other 2K titles, like Borderlands, have also regularly appeared on the Game Pass service, and the cycle of sports games usually sees them move to the service in the final few months of their lifespan before the latest release is dropped.

Therefore, if NBA 2K26 is to come to the service, don’t expect it to occur before 2026, unless a free-play weekend or a similar incentive is announced later in the year.

Have you purchased NBA 2K26? What are your thoughts on the game? Let us know during the Insider Gaming forum.

For more NBA 2K26, check out the full soundtrack of 43 songs, and take a look at the latest trailer for the MyCareer mode.
